documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
de-
prives me of my future, of the life that I would have lived if I had lived out
my natural life span.
The  loss  of  a  future  biological  life  does  not  explain  the  misfortune  of
death. Compare two scenarios: in the former I now fall into a coma from
which I do not recover until my death in thirty years. In the latter I die now.
The latter scenario does not seem to describe a greater misfortune than the
former.
The loss of our future conscious life is what underlies the misfortune of
p
